main event: A bright light, about the same magnitude as Venus or Jupiter, was observed moving across the sky from zenith to 240-350 degrees in 3-5 seconds in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin.
interesting points: The object was a steady white color with no additional colors, marks, or other identifiable features.
The object's estimated speed was Mach 2 or 3, based on the witness's calculations that it traveled around 2.5 miles in 3-5 seconds.
The object's course was a straight line from zenith to 310° or 350°, with no apparent variations.
The object's height was estimated to be between 14,000 and 16,000 feet MSL, with an alto-cumulus layer estimated at 6,000 to 8,000 feet MSL.
The witness had been a co-op weather observer for the Milwaukee weather bureau and had studied observations made by themselves and others in the hope of cloud height visual observation.
